about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: This road sign means:
hasPart.assesses: This road sign means: | This road sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to the right lane ending and tells them to prepare for potential merging traffic.

comment.text: Highway entrance ramp.
Road widens.
Right lane ends.
Right lane ends.

answerExplanation.text: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to the right lane ending and tells them to prepare for potential merging traffic.

comment.text: This road sign means: | Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to the right lane ending and tells them to prepare for potential merging traffic.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: This road sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions

hasPart.name: The driver ahead of you stops at a crosswalk. What should you do?

about.name: The driver ahead of you stops at a crosswalk. What should you do?

hasPart.assesses: The driver ahead of you stops at a crosswalk. What should you do? | The driver ahead of you stops at a crosswalk. What should you do? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You must not pass a vehicle that is stopped at a crosswalk. There may be pedestrians crossing the street that you cannot see. Instead, stop, proceeding only after all pedestrians have crossed.

suggestedAnswer.text: Cautiously pass the vehicle at 10 mph or slower.

comment.text: Cautiously pass the vehicle at 10 mph or slower.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop, proceeding only when all the pedestrians have crossed.

comment.text: Stop, proceeding only when all the pedestrians have crossed.

suggestedAnswer.text: Change lanes, look carefully, and pass the stopped vehicle.

comment.text: Change lanes, look carefully, and pass the stopped vehicle.

acceptedAnswer.text: Stop, proceeding only when all the pedestrians have crossed.

comment.text: Stop, proceeding only when all the pedestrians have crossed.

answerExplanation.text: You must not pass a vehicle that is stopped at a crosswalk. There may be pedestrians crossing the street that you cannot see. Instead, stop, proceeding only after all pedestrians have crossed.

comment.text: The driver ahead of you stops at a crosswalk. What should you do? | You must not pass a vehicle that is stopped at a crosswalk. There may be pedestrians crossing the street that you cannot see. Instead, stop, proceeding only after all pedestrians have crossed.

hasPart.name: This yellow sign means:
hasPart.assesses: This yellow sign means: | This yellow sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A yellow sign with a traffic signal pictured indicates that there is a traffic signal is ahead. Be prepared to respond to the upcoming traffic signal.

comment.text: Controlled railroad ahead.

suggestedAnswer.text: Be prepared to stop if the light is flashing.

comment.text: Be prepared to stop if the light is flashing.

suggestedAnswer.text: There is a traffic signal ahead.

comment.text: There is a traffic signal ahead.

acceptedAnswer.text: There is a traffic signal ahead.

comment.text: There is a traffic signal ahead.

answerExplanation.text: A yellow sign with a traffic signal pictured indicates that there is a traffic signal is ahead. Be prepared to respond to the upcoming traffic signal.

hasPart.name: You may be able to identify an aggressive driver by:

about.name: You may be able to identify an aggressive driver by:

hasPart.assesses: You may be able to identify an aggressive driver by: | You may be able to identify an aggressive driver by: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: While driving, you should remain aware of the actions of surrounding drivers. If you notice an aggressive driver nearby making erratic or improper lane changes, you should not challenge them. The safest way to handle an aggressive driver is to get out of their way.

suggestedAnswer.text: Their erratic and improper lane changes.

comment.text: Their erratic and improper lane changes.

suggestedAnswer.text: The number of passengers in their car.

comment.text: The number of passengers in their car.
Their tendency to drive slowly.

acceptedAnswer.text: Their erratic and improper lane changes.

comment.text: Their erratic and improper lane changes.

answerExplanation.text: While driving, you should remain aware of the actions of surrounding drivers. If you notice an aggressive driver nearby making erratic or improper lane changes, you should not challenge them. The safest way to handle an aggressive driver is to get out of their way.

comment.text: You may be able to identify an aggressive driver by: | While driving, you should remain aware of the actions of surrounding drivers. If you notice an aggressive driver nearby making erratic or improper lane changes, you should not challenge them. The safest way to handle an aggressive driver is to get out of their way.

hasPart.name: When may you legally drive around or under a railroad crossing gate?

about.name: When may you legally drive around or under a railroad crossing gate?

hasPart.assesses: When may you legally drive around or under a railroad crossing gate? | When may you legally drive around or under a railroad crossing gate? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Do not go around or under any lowered gate at a railroad crossing. Once the gate is raised, do not proceed across the tracks until you can see clearly in both directions and are sure there are no trains coming.

comment.text: Never.

suggestedAnswer.text: When you can see clearly in both directions.

comment.text: When you can see clearly in both directions.

suggestedAnswer.text: When the warning lights are not flashing.

comment.text: When the warning lights are not flashing.
Never.

answerExplanation.text: Do not go around or under any lowered gate at a railroad crossing. Once the gate is raised, do not proceed across the tracks until you can see clearly in both directions and are sure there are no trains coming.

comment.text: When may you legally drive around or under a railroad crossing gate? | Do not go around or under any lowered gate at a railroad crossing. Once the gate is raised, do not proceed across the tracks until you can see clearly in both directions and are sure there are no trains coming.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: When may you legally drive around or under a railroad crossing gate? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions

hasPart.name: When driving on the highway, consistently looking far ahead of your vehicle:

about.name: When driving on the highway, consistently looking far ahead of your vehicle:

hasPart.assesses: When driving on the highway, consistently looking far ahead of your vehicle: | When driving on the highway, consistently looking far ahead of your vehicle: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: To avoid the need for last-minute braking or turning, consistently watch the road far ahead of your vehicle. By looking ahead and being ready to stop or change lanes if needed, you can drive more safely, save fuel, and help keep traffic moving at a steady pace.

suggestedAnswer.text: Helps you keep up with traffic.

comment.text: Helps you keep up with traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: Reduces the need for last-minute braking or turning.

comment.text: Reduces the need for last-minute braking or turning.

suggestedAnswer.text: Allows you to spot upcoming police officers.

comment.text: Allows you to spot upcoming police officers.

acceptedAnswer.text: Reduces the need for last-minute braking or turning.

comment.text: Reduces the need for last-minute braking or turning.

answerExplanation.text: To avoid the need for last-minute braking or turning, consistently watch the road far ahead of your vehicle. By looking ahead and being ready to stop or change lanes if needed, you can drive more safely, save fuel, and help keep traffic moving at a steady pace.

comment.text: When driving on the highway, consistently looking far ahead of your vehicle: | To avoid the need for last-minute braking or turning, consistently watch the road far ahead of your vehicle. By looking ahead and being ready to stop or change lanes if needed, you can drive more safely, save fuel, and help keep traffic moving at a steady pace.
